tuv.seg: Overview of problem debt
Forbhreathnú ar fhiachas fadhbach
• Getting help from MABS
• Cabhair a fháil ó MABS
• What you can do yourself
• Conas fiacha a láimhseáil tú féin
Any form of credit is a debt, so most people have some debts
Is fiacha atá i chuile chinéal creidmhis. Mar sin, tá fiacha ag beagnach gach duine
It is only when you are unable to keep up with the payments that your debt becomes a problem
Ní bhíonn fadhb ann ach nuair nach bhfuil tú ábalta coinneáil suas le do chuid íocaíochtaí
If you are in this situation, for whatever reason, you may find yourself having some of the following difficulties:
Má tá tú sa staid seo, d'fhéadfadh na deacrachtaí seo leanas a bheith i gceist:
• Missed payments and letters from creditors
• Bheith ar gcúl le hiocaíochtaí agus litreacha ag teacht ó chreidiúnaithe
• Borrowing money to pay bills and catch up with arrears
• Ag fáil íasachtaí chun billí a íoc agus breith suas ar íocaíochtaí
• Paying whichever creditor is putting on most pressure
• Ag íoc cibé creidiúnaí atá ag cur an méid is mó brú ort
• Making promises to pay unreasonable amounts
• Ag déanamh geallúintí méideanna mí-réasúnta a íoc
• Broken promises and more pressure from creditors
• Geallúintí briste agus tuilleadh brú ó chreidiúnaithe
It is vital to take action to deal with your debts and stop the situation from getting any worse
Tá sé an-tábhachtach déileáil le d’fhiachais ionas nach n-éireoidh an staid níos measa
For example, if you don’t start getting your debts under control, your creditors could go to court and eventually repossess your home
Mar shampla, mura ndéileálann tú le d’fhiachais, d’fhéadfaí do theach a athshealbhú
This can happen even if you have no mortgage on your home or your mortgage payments are up to date
Is féidir go dtarlódh sé seo fiú muna bhfuil morgáiste nó riaráistí morgáiste agat
Getting help from MABS
Cabhair a fháil ó MABS
The Money Advice and Budgeting Service (MABS) is a free and confidential service for people with debt problems and money management problems
Is seirbhís rúnda agus saor in aisce í an tSeirbhís Bhuiséadta agus Chomhairle Airgid (MABS) do dhaoine a bhfuil fadhbanna acu maidir le fiachas agus airgead a bhainistiú
MABS can help you to explore your options and deal with your debt in a systematic way
Is féidir le MABS cabhrú leat do roghanna a scrúdú agus déileáil le d’fhiachais go córasach
Its website mabs.ie has several useful resources, including a self-help guide – see ‘What you can do yourself’ below
Tá acmhainní úsáideacha ar a láithreán gréasáin mabs.ie, ina measc treoir féin-chabhrach - féach 'Cad is féidir a dhéanamh tú féin' thíos
Dealing with creditors: MABS has agreed a protocol (pdf) with the Banking and Payments Federation of Ireland (BPFI) to help people to manage their debt repayments in a way that they can afford

Deileáil le do chreidiúnaithe: D'fhorbair MABS agus Cónaidhm Bhaincéireachta agus Íocaíochtaí na hÉireann (BPFI) prótacal (pdf) chun cabhrú le daoine atá i bhfiacha a n-aisíocaíochtaí a bhainistiú ar bhealach inbhuanaithe
The lenders that have signed up to the protocol have committed to work with MABS money advisers to help customers to address their debt problems and agree a sustainable plan of repayments
Oibríonn na hinstitiúidí creidmheasa a shínigh an prótacal le comhairleoirí airgid MABS chun cabhrú le custaiméirí aghaidh a thabhairt ar fhadhbanna fiachais agus iad a bhainistiú
The protocol allows for write-off of some debt, at the lender’s discretion
Ceadaítear sa phrótacal do dhíscríobh roinnt fiachais, faoi rogha an iasachtóra
It does not apply to mortgage debt
Ní bhíonn feidhm leis d’fhiach morgáiste
You can read more about this protocol in these FAQs (pdf)
Léigh tuilleadh sna ceisteanna coitianta seo (pdf)
Separately from this protocol, MABS can also help you to agree a sustainable repayment plan with your other creditors
Ar leithligh ón bprótacal seo, is féidir le MABS cabhrú leat plean inbhuanaithe i leith aisíocaíochtaí a chomhaontú le creidiúnaithe eile freisin

Accessing personal insolvency options: All MABS services are registered as Approved Intermediaries with the Insolvency Service of Ireland (ISI) and can bring you through the process of getting a Debt Relief Notice if this is an appropriate solution for you

Rochtain a fháil ar roghanna dócmhainneachta pearsanta: Bíonn gach seirbhís MABS cláraithe mar Idirghabhálaithe Ceadaithe le Seirbhís Dócmhainneachta na hÉireann (SDÉ) agus is féidir leo tú a thabhairt trí phróiseas Fhógra Faoisimh Fhiachais a fháil más réiteach iomchuí duitse é sin
MABS can also advise you on how to access the other personal insolvency options – see below
Is féidir leis an MABS comhairle a thabhairt duit freisin faoin gcaoi chun rochtain a fháil ar roghanna dócmhainneachta pearsanta eile – féach thíos
Dealing with mortgage arrears: MABS has a Dedicated Mortgage Arrears service in over 20 locations
Dul i ngleic le riaráistí morgáiste: Tá seirbhís shaintiomanta ag MABS do Riaráistí Morgáiste i níos mó ná 20 suíomh
It also operates a court mentor service, in collaboration with the Insolvency Service of Ireland (ISI), to assist debtors faced with court proceedings
Oibríonn sé seirbhís mheantóra cúirte freisin, i gcomhar le Seirbhís Dócmhainneachta na hÉireann (SDÉ), chun cúnamh le féichiúnaithe a thagann os comhair imeachtaí cúirte
Read more about these services
Léigh a thuilleadh faoi na seirbhísí úd
MABS is also centrally involved in a new aid and advice scheme for people in serious mortgage arrears, as part of Abhaile, the national Mortgage Arrears Resolution Service

Bíonn MABS bainteach go lárnach freisin le scéim chabhrach agus chomhairle nua do dhaoine le riaráistí morgáiste tromchúiseacha, mar chuid de Abhaile, an tSeirbhís Náisiúnta um Réiteach na Riaráistí Morgáiste
This service was launched in October 2016
Seoladh an tseirbhís úd i mí Dheireadh Fómhair 2016
Contacting MABS: The MABS Helpline 0761 07 2000 is open from 9am to 8pm, Monday to Friday
Dul i dteagmháil le MABS: Tá Líne Chabhrach MABS 0761 07 2000 ar fáil Luan go hAoine idir 9rn agus 8in
You can also email helpline@mabs.ie or you can make an appointment to meet a money adviser in person in one of the nationwide network of MABS offices
Is féidir ríomhphost a sheoladh chuig helpline@mabs.ie nó is féidir leat teagmháil a dhéanamh le d’oifig MABS áitiúil chun comhairle agus cúnamh a fháil ó chomhairleoir airgid
Three personal insolvency options have been introduced for people who cannot afford to pay their personal and mortgage debts
Táthar tar éis trí rogha dócmhainneachta pearsanta a thabhairt isteach do dhaoine nach bhfuil ar a n-acmhainn a gcuid fiach pearsanta agus morgáiste a íoc
The system of bankruptcy has also been updated
Táthar tar éis an córas féimheachta a nuashonrú freisin
The Insolvency Service of Ireland (ISI) administers all of these debt resolution processes
Is í Seirbhís Dócmhainneachta na hÉireann (SDÉ) a riarann na próisis réitigh fhiachais sin go léir
It publishes extensive information on its website, isi.gov.ie
Foilsíonn sí faisnéis fhairsing ar a láithreán gréasáin, isi.gov.ie
The ISI also has a debtor-focused website backontrack.ie, giving examples of how individuals have managed to resolve their problem debt, along with step-by-step guides on dealing with debt

Tá láithreán gréasáin ag an SDÉ atá dírithe ar fhéichiúnaithe backontrack.ie, ina dtugtar samplaí den chaoi ar éirigh le daoine aonair chun a bhfiach fabhtach a réiteach, i dteannta le treoracha céimnithe chun dul i ngleic le fiachas
You can use the website to request a callback, or you can contact the ISI’s helpline 0761 06 4200, which is open from 9am to 6pm, Monday to Friday

Is féidir leat úsáid a bhaint as an láithreán gréasáin chun athghlao a iarraidh, nó is féidir leat teagmháil a dhéanamh le líne chabhrach na SDÉ ag 0761 06 4200, a bhíonn ar oscailt idir 9r.n. agus 6i.n., Luan go hAoine
The ISI has also published a quick guide to debt solutions (pdf) and the “Back on Track” guide to problem debt (pdf)

Tá an SDÉ tar éis quick guide to debt solutions (pdf) (mearthreoir do réitigh ar fhiachas agus “Back on Track” guide to problem debt (pdf) (Treoir “Teacht Aniar” i leith an fhiachais fhabhtaigh) a fhoilsiú freisin
What you can do yourself
Conas fiacha a láimhseáil tú féin
If you are in mortgage arrears, or feel you are likely to be in mortgage arrears soon, the most important step you can take is to contact your lender immediately

Má tá riaráistí morgáiste agat, nó go mbraitheann tú gur dócha go mbeidh riaráistí morgáiste agat go luath, is í an chéim is tábhachtaí ar féidir leat a ghlacadh ná chun teagmháil a dhéanamh le d’iasachtóir láithreach bonn
You can find out more in our overview of mortgage debt
Is féidir leat teacht ar a thuilleadh inár bhforbhreathnú ar an bhfiach morgáiste
For other debts, it is also very important to let your creditors know that you are having difficulties
Tá sé fíor-thabhachtach dul i dteagmháil le do chreidiúnaithe agus fios a chur orthu go bhfuil fadhbanna agat
Then you will be able to work with them to deal with the situation
Ansin beidh tú in ann obair in éineacht leo chun dul i ngleic le do chuid fadhbanna
Otherwise the problems and the pressure from creditors will just get worse
Seachas sin, rachadh na fadhbanna agus an brú ó do chreidiúnaithe i ndonas
Even if you have already sought help, you can use the MABS self-help tool to help you through the following steps:
Fiú má tá cabhair á lorg agat cheana féin, is féidir treoir féin-chabhrach MABS a úsáid chun na céimeanna seo a leanúint:
Make a list of all your debts
Déan amach liosta de d'fhiacha uile
Check that each debt is in your name
Ceadaigh gur faoi d’ainm é gach fiach
Identify the debts needing immediate attention (for example, your mortgage arrears)
Aithin na fiacha óna dteastaíonn aird láithreach (mar shampla, do riaráistí morgáiste)
Get in touch with the lenders immediately - preferably in writing
Déan teagmháil leis na hiasachtóirí láithreach - b’fhearr í a chur i scríbhinn
There is a sample letter on the MABS website
Tá litir shamplach ar láithreán gréasáin SBCA
List how much money is coming into your household each week (or month) and how much is going out
Liostaigh cé mhéid airgid a thagann isteach gach seachtain (no gach mí) agus cé mhéid airgid a théann amach
You can get useful documents like a blank budget sheet and spending diary (pdf) from the MABS website or request them through the MABS helpline
Is féidir leat cáipéisí úsáideacha agus bileog bhuiséid bhán spending diary (pdf)(dialann chaiteachais) a fháil ó láithreán gréasáin MABS féin nó iad a iarraidh trí líne chabhrach MABS
MABS also has a dedicated budgeting tool
Tá uirlis bhuiséadaithe tool shaintiomanta ag MABS freisin
Deal with the debt
Deileáil leis na fiacha
Write to the lender, making an offer of the amount you can afford to pay and explaining your financial situation
Scríobh chuig an iasachtóir, tairg an méid airgid is féidir leat a íoc agus déan cur síos ar do staid airgeadais
The MABS website has a sample letter of offer and blank financial statements
Tá litir shamplach ar láithreán MABS
Organise a method of paying the agreed amount
Cuir córas i bhfeidhm chun an t-airgead a íoc
You can do this in various ways, such as direct debit, internet banking or a MABS Budget Account
Is féidir leat é sin a dhéanamh ar bhealaí éagsúla, ar nós an dochair dhírigh, na baincéireachta idirlín nó Cuntais Bhuiséid MABS
There are different forms of debt, including mortgages, loans, overdrafts, credit cards and hire purchase agreements
Tá cineálacha éagsúla fiachais ann, lena n-áirítear morgáistí, iasachtaí, ró-tharraingtí, cártaí creidmheasa agus comhaontuithe fruilcheannaigh
Some debts, for example, mortgages, are secured – this means that goods or property, usually your house, is used as security in case the debt is not paid
Tá roinnt fiachais, mar shampla, morgáistí, 'urraithe' - ciallaíonn sé sin go n-úsáidtear earraí nó maoin, do theach de ghnáth, mar urrús sa chás nach n-íoctar an fiachas
Find out more about types of debt and debt terminology in our glossary of debt terms
Faigh tuilleadh eolais faoi na cineálacha fiachais agus téarmaíocht a bhaineann le fiachas inár ngluais téarmaí a bhaineann le fiachas
Some debts have specific rules and practices in place in relation to how they are managed and collected
Baineann rialacha agus nósanna imeachta ar leith le roinnt fiachas maidir leis an gcaoi a mbainistítear agus a mbailítear iad
These are mainly debts which are owed to the State or a State body
Is fiachais iad seo den chuid is mó atá dlite don Stát nó do chomhlacht Stáit
In particular, taxes, social welfare overpayments, local authority rents and housing loans, utility bills and TV licences all have specific rules and procedures

Tá rialacha agus nósanna imeachta ar leith ag cánacha, ró-íocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh, cíosanna údaráis áitiúla agus iasachtaí tithíochta, táillí dramhaíola, billí fóntais, ceadúnais teilifíse agus ceadúnais mhadra go háirithe
Find out more about the rules for specific debts
Faigh tuilleadh eolais faoi na rialacha maidir le fiachais ar leith
There are general rules under consumer credit legislation in relation to collecting debts, including rules in relation to privacy, contact points and harassment and intimidation
Tá rialacha ann faoi reachtaíocht chreidmheasa tomhaltóirí maidir le bailiú fiachas, lena n-áirítear rialacha maidir le príobháideachas, pointí teagmhála agus ciapadh agus imeaglú
There is a particular code of conduct for how lenders must engage with people in mortgage arrears or pre-arrears
Is ann do chód iompair faoi leith don chaoi ina gcaitheann iasachtóirí dul i ngleic le daoine le riaráistí nó le réamhriaráistí morgáiste
If you do not engage with your lender, your lender will most likely initiate legal proceedings to recover the debt
Mura ndéanann tú teagmháil le d'iasachtóir, tá gach cosúlacht ann go gcuirfidh sé tús le himeachtaí dlíthiúla chun an fiachas a aisghabháil
The case can be taken in the District Court, Circuit Court or High Court, depending on the amount of money involved
Is féidir an cás a thógáil sa Chúirt Dúiche, sa Chúirt Chuarda nó san Ard-Chúirt, ag brath ar an méid airgid atá i gceist
Once your lender has a Court judgment setting out the debt, this judgment can be enforced in various ways, including, in extreme cases, through bankruptcy proceedings
Nuair a dhéantar breithiúnas sa chúirt ina leagtar amach an fiachas, is féidir an breithiúnas seo a chur i bhfeidhm ar bhealaí éagsúla, lena n-áirítear imeachtaí féimheachta i gcásanna tromchúiseacha
Being in arrears on debt repayments can also have other consequences, for example, it can affect your credit rating and make it difficult to get credit in the future

D’fhéadfadh go mbeadh iarmhairtí eile i gceist nuair atá tú i riaráiste ar aisíocaíochtaí fiachais chomh maith, mar shampla, d’fhéadfadh sé dul i bhfeidhm ar do ráta creidmheasa, rud a chiallódh go mbeadh sé deacair creidmheas a fháil sa todhchaí
When someone has died, there are detailed rules about how their debts must be dealt with
Is ann do rialacha mionsonraithe faoin gcaoi ina gcaithfear lena bhfiacha nuair a fhaigheann duine éigin bás
You can read more about current and proposed developments on personal debt and mortgage arrears in our document on responses to mortgage arrears and personal debt
Tá tuilleadh eolais faoi phleananna maidir le nósanna imeachta i leith fiachais inár gcáipéis Freagairtí maidir le riaráistí morgáiste agus fiachas pearsanta
